title: ANZ profit takes fresh compensation hit
text:
ANZ's half-year cash profits will be hit by a $559 million customer remediation bill, the bulk of which relates to products and services the bank is not offloading in its planned wealth business sale to IOOF.

The bank informed the Australian Securities Exchange on Tuesday that costs emanating from its remediation program will run to $405 million after tax for "fee and interest calculation and related matters" in its core retail and commercial banking businesses.

ANZ's total customer remediation bill now exceeds $1.1 billion. Carla Gottgens

It will also pay out $154 million to customers of its discontinued financial advice and wealth product operations, which are in varying stages of being offloaded to IOOF as part of the $1 billion pensions and investments subsidiary transaction.

The fresh remediation figures take ANZ's total customer compensation bill to $1.1 billion over the 2018-19 full two-year period.

"We recognise the impact this has on both customers and shareholders," said the bank's chief financial officer, Michelle Jablko. "We are well progressed in fixing issues and have a dedicated team of more than 500 specialists working hard to get any money owed back to customers as quickly as possible."
description: ANZ has revealed its total customer remediation bill now exceeds $1.1 billion after ASIC took issue with its compensation methodology.
